intro: Ferulago fieldiana, commonly known as the Balkan ferulago, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a slightly hairy surface. Ferulago fieldiana is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to grow in cooler, higher elevation environments.
